text: I think the distinction (aka limiting factor) here is that `mynumber"1.1"` has no other interpretation other than the `@mynumber_str "1.1"` , but `mynumber1.1` would be interpreted as the (invalid) `1` field/property of the value referenced by the `mynumber1` variable.  Integer-macros would be indistinguishable from real variable names (`foo1` is a valid variable name, so it can't be the same as `@foo_num 1`)
